name: thundr.ca
description: A full stack SaaS which automates the creation, sale, and maintenance of websites for construction & home service businesses. Backed by a multi-billion dollar VC headquartered Waterloo Ontario.

name: Infrascan
description: A full stack SaaS for analyzing the community landscape in a neighbourhood. Multi-award winning and admitted to DMZ-Basecamp, the worlds largest university startup incubator.

name: EEG-Tickle-Detection
description: Using brain-computer interfaces to detect tickling and stop medical failures. Yes tickling... There is a video of this project in the public/videos folder of this repository.

name: Evolutionary-Network
description: High performance feed-forward back propagation neutral network written in Zig.

name: Evolutionary-Snake
description: An evolutionary algorithm which develops neural networks to play the classic game of snake.

name: Grinch-Simulator
description: Submission to MCPT's 2022 winter game jam. Uses a tetris inspired maze generator, Zig, cool shadow graphics, and web assembly.

name: Machine-Learning-BattleSnake-Tools
description: An advanced suite of Python tools for creating Tensorflow neural networks to play BattleSnake.

name: Neuroblock
description: Use visual programming to make brain computer interface (BCI) programs. I have a video of this in the public/videos folder of this repository. Made for UofT Hacks 2025.

name: fcpl
description: A small functional programming language which transpiles to JavaScript

name: Perceptron-Library
description: A multi-layer perceptron library written in plain JavaScript. I wrote this project when I was 12 years old, after I watched a youtube video about the (much too advanced for 8th grade me) math behind machine learning.

name: thundr-Models
description: Creating minimally sized machine learning models which can perform website text & image classification on edge devices with 10x efficiency over leading solutions.

name: readytoprogram.xyz
description: My highschools computer science curriculum was severely outdated. On my own time, I made a website which thoroughly documents the functionality of the 30 year old software the class uses. This website is still used by student across Ontario!

name: Ants-Simulation
description: An Ant colony optimization simulation written in pure JavaScript. A heuristic solution to the travelling salesman problem.

name: Baron-Berkelys
description: The game I created for my grade 9 final computer science project. Play as a Death Eater navigating through the magical world while capturing unique animals. I wrote a custom real-time GPU shader engine in GLSL to get cool lighting effects & day/night cycle.

name: Brain-Parser
description: A modified Brain**** interpreter written in Java.

name: C-Flappy-Bird
description: An implementation of flappy bird in C using Raylib.

name: C3-Snake
description: An implementation of the classic game of snake in the C3 programming language.

name: Caged
description: The final project for my grade 12 computer science course. A Java FX game where the user plays as someone suffering from depression and gains valuable life insight while traversing through a dungeon platformer.

name: CellTeacher
description: Use cellular automata to teach coding through a simple editor. Made for Lyon Hacks II.

name: Discord-Status-Changer
description: Automatically change your discord status using Python or JavaScript.

name: Drag-Tracker
description: A simple webpage to test your clicking speed.

name: Exam-Buster
description: A set of tools which use AI to help students prepare for an exam. Built for Cerebras hackathon 2025.

name: Fundi
description: Final project for CSC207, a Java swing app for managing a stock portfolio.

name: Gerald
description: A chrome web extension which overrides the default new tab page with a productive set of tools for everyday web browsing.

name: Log
description: A simple interpreted stack-based programming language written in Elixir.

name: Maze-Marauder
description: Go into the dungeon, keep warm with torches, find a sutible weapon, and hope the cold doesn't come alive...

name: Odin-Snake
description: An implementation of the classic game of snake in Odin, a programming language meant for modern high-performance game development.

name: Pike-Snake
description: Implementation of the classic game of snake in Pike, a lesser known programming language made for creating text-based dungeon games in the 90s.

name: Plant-Nutrient-Simulator
description: A demo and explaination of concentration changes in plant root cells. Made for a chemistry assignment.

name: PostWorthy
description: A web app which scrapes a subreddit and performs extensive data analysis and natural language processing to determine what keywords, topics, etc get the most interactions. Made for SpurHacks 2025.

name: Pour
description: A game created in 3 hours for Trijam 97.

name: Python-Wordle-Bot
description: A python bot for the popular word game Wordle. Uses statistics and information theory to solve the puzzles in 3-4 guesses.

name: Flip-Drip
description: Tinder for clothing. Find your style! Made for Rhythm Hacks 2023

name: Sadge-Button
description: Click the button... If you can...

name: AI-Movie-Name-Generator
description: Using pre-GPT-3 technologies to create a natural language processing engine capable of producing novel movie names given a description of their plot.

name: Space-Chase
description: A game written in Zig and compiled with web assembly for Ludum Dare 51.

name: Tic-Tac-Toe
description: A simple game of Tic Tac Toe written in React.

name: TimeZap
description: VS Code extension that tracks the time you spend coding.

name: Towers-of-Hanoi
description: An implementation (and solution) of the classic Towers of Hanoi problem in plain JavaScript.
